Guideshop Operator

Company Name GFG Alliance - Australia Company Location Laverton, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 7 views

Job description

About GFG Alliance

GFG Alliance has an agile, entrepreneurial culture with high energy, strong levels of ambition, and sustainable growth plans. This brings opportunities for GFG’s people and businesses to flourish and develop. We work with our people to determine how we can grow our business and our future. We are committed to uncompromising levels of safety, strong customer centricity and diversity. Wherever they are in the world, our people are our greatest asset. We welcome you to join us.

About The Role

Liberty Steel, part of the GFG Alliance group, operates a world-class state-of-the-art Steelmaking facility based in Laverton. We use local raw materials to produce high quality steel products in partnership with our loyal customers in the local construction and other industries, while building on our proud traditions of technical excellence and team safety.

Reporting to Shift Leaders, our Guideshop Operators are responsible for a number of tasks in support of production including overhead crane operation. As a member of our team you will support our Goal Zero safety target, will follow instructions and adhere to strict work processes. Those with a Trade Qualifications and strong mechanical aptitude will be viewed favourably as will those with any relevant tickets; overhead crane, forklift etc.

This is a permanent full-time position that is hands on and physically demanding however, is equally as rewarding. Day shift hours 6:00am – 2:30pm, Monday to Friday.

With multiple positions available, apply now to speak with the GFG Talent Acquisition team.

Liberty OneSteel is an Equal Opportunity Employer that respects diversity and encourages candidates from various backgrounds to apply.

Why work for GFG Alliance?

Across our different business units, we offer career opportunities for people who share our drive, passion and ambition. From apprentices and graduates to experienced professionals, we are committed to offering fulfilling careers and the chance to grow as our business grows. We would love you to be part of our journey.

912846099:
[

Occupational Therapist

Company Name The GEO Group Australia Company Location Ravenhall, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you an Occupational Therapist interested in applying your expertise to work with clients with complex presentations and needs?


Are you interested in being part of a multidisciplinary clinical team focused upon assisting prisoners to develop healthier functioning in prison and post-release?


Apply now for this exciting position


About the Opportunity


Ravenhall Correctional Centre is seeking an Occupational Therapist (.6 FTE) who will identify and promote interventions to develop, recover or maintain the daily living, vocational and recreational skills of prisoners pre- and post-release with a physical, mental or developmental condition. This position will play an important role in assisting prisoners in the development of healthier ways of functioning in the prison setting, including emphasis on increasing a prisoner’s level of independence, achievement of personal goals and self-management. The Occupational Therapist will contribute to multidisciplinary case-management plans and reviews including behaviour-management plans, with a focus on maximising the prisoner’s involvement in managing their own health and risk.


In this role you will: \xa0


  • Provide expert occupational therapy consultancy, pre- and post-release assessment and intervention.
  • Promote interventions to develop, recover or maintain the daily living, vocational and recreational skills of prisoners pre- and post-release with a physical, mental or developmental condition.
  • Assist prisoners in the development of healthier ways of functioning in the prison setting, including emphasis on increasing a prisoner’s level of independence, achievement of personal goals and self-management.
  • Provide pre- and post-release occupational therapy interventions to increase successful community integration and reduce risk of recidivism.
  • Assist the broader clinical team with the co-facilitation of programs
  • Contribute to case-management planning and case reviews, behaviour management plans, suicide and self-harm reviews, and community reintegration plans.


Participate in clinical supervision and professional development opportunities.Your Skills & Experience

To be successful in the role of Occupational Therapist at Ravenhall you will have:


  • Registration with the Occupational Therapy Board of Australia.
  • Ability to assess a prisoner’s occupational therapy needs, developing case formulations and treatment plans, with the aim of successful community reintegration and ultimately reducing risk of reoffending.
  • Demonstrated experience in clinical/behavioural/risk assessment, individual and group intervention, in a clinical or other relevant setting.
  • Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively with others both cross-agency and as part of a multidisciplinary team of professionals.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to effectively and efficiently prepare clinical formulations and reports.
  • Ability to work as a member of a multi-disciplinary team that involves direct contact with prisoners in a correctional environment and post-release in the community.


About the Benefits

Joining GEO is your chance to make a real and lasting difference in the lives of prisoners, their families and the community. Benefits of working for GEO, include but are not limited to:


  • Role diversity and internal career progression opportunities
  • Ongoing professional development opportunities (including further education sponsorship)
  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Competitive salary and rewards scheme
  • Free parking
  • Employee Assistance Program
  • Staff gym
  • Subsidised meals

\xa0

Make a real difference – Apply Now!

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are highly encouraged to apply

Applications close 17 October 2018

\xa0

For enquiries please contact Danielle Kozminski, HR Officer or Ana Cuchilla-Castillo, HR Officer on 03 8363 2658.


Please note: Shortlisted candidates will be contacted approximately 2-3 weeks following the closing date. Unsuccessful candidates will be contacted in due course.

Marketing Campaign Coordinator

Company Name 3 Phase Marketing Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 171 views

Job description

Marketing Campaign Manager

Our Culture

3 Phase Marketing is a specialist full service agency based in Melbourne with a strong focus on the automotive industry. We are a multi-disciplined agency with a reputation for delivering outstanding results for our clients.


We work to foster a positive environment for our staff whilst upholding the highest possible standards for both the work we produce and client service. For us, every hurdle and obstacle is an opportunity to grow. Our ethos is to grow our people both professionally and personally.


Our Company Philosophy

We value collaboration, clarity, honesty, and surprise; people who have energy, optimism and enthusiasm; with a can do attitude and high emotional intelligence; people who enjoy working and collaborating with others to deliver authentic storytelling.


About the Role

3 Phase Marketing is seeking a marketing whiz ready for the next step in their marketing career. We are looking for a hands on professional to coordinate and execute a diverse range of key marketing initiatives.


You'll be responsible for an exciting variety of marketing activities including content creation for external communications, preparing design briefs and brainstorming campaign ideas for our retail automotive clients.


You will play an important role within the agency team, working closely with our design, digital and social teams. You will delivery a superior level of customer service to our incredible clients.


DUTIES

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Coordinate and develop marketing schedules including activity, time lines and costs

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Translate briefs from client conversations into briefing documents for approval and to supply into the studio

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Manage the production process and approvals for all marketing materials: Campaign concepts, eDM’s, Facebook, Website assets, Digital banners, Video production, print and radio commercials\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Prepare, edit and proof copy for eDMs, newsletters, web, social meida and radio

\xb7\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0Coordinate website updates with external providers

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Send eDM & SMS campaigns through relevant software platforms

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Liaise regularly with key clients both at senior and intermediate levels

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Attend client meetings from time to time and briefing sessions

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Enter jobs and costs accurately into internal workflow software (WorkflowMax)

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Enter media billings into BCC software

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proof read advertising material, product disclaimers, terms and conditions

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Maintain and update the internal and external customer database

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Maintain and update client mandatories and client preferences

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Move jobs to draft invoices at the end of the month

\xa0

SKILLS | EXPERIENCE | QUALIFICATIONS

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proven ability with a minimum 3 years demonstrated experience in marketing and advertising, preferably within an agency environment or similar role i.e. sales support in media company

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Exceptional communication skills both verbal and written, excelling in grammar and sentence structure

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Strong organisation and time management skills

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to prioritise and multitask a range of different duties at one time

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to work accurately under pressure

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Proficiency in writing marketing material as well as writing content for client external communications

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Attention to detail essential – this is critical

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to negotiate with a variety of stakeholders with a view to achieve goals

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Experience in one or more of the following: MAC programs, Excel, Mail Chimp, Workflow Max, Trello


ARE YOU INTERESTED?

If you would like to join a premium, hard-working team with a focus on first class services for our clients then please apply.


Please include a cover letter in your application. Please ensure the cover letter and CV are submitted as one document.


Due to the high volume of applicants, please note that only successful candidates will be contacted.


We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from all sections of the community. Please only apply if you currently have the right to work in Australia / a valid current Australian working visa / citizenship.


Applications Close by 9pm - 28th October 2018\xa0\xa0

Retention Consultant

Company Name Sumo Company Location South Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 21 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Sumo is a new and exciting energy and telecommunications retailer who has a dynamic, fun and highly engaged culture that we want to continue to build. Our mission and vision is to give households and small business greater choice and better rewards, by offering electricity, gas and internet connections within Australia.


The role of the Retention Consultant is to manage all customer retention activities. The retention consultant will liaise with customers to pro-actively and reactively retain business, using customer service, sales and negotiation skills to overcome objections and work towards a solution all while putting the customers’ needs first.


The key accountabilities include the following:

  • Outbound call existing customers who have initiated a transfer to a competitor;
  • Take inbound calls from new/existing customers who have expressed wanting to cancel their transfer to Sumo or indicated that they wish to leave;
  • Work closely with various Sumo teams to ensure customer satisfaction;
  • Up-sell/cross-sell current customers on new products or services;
  • Provide feedback to management on trends for cancellations and product issues;
  • Maintain a high level of customer administration for all activities;
  • Educate customers on new products, releases, features and benefits in being with Sumo;
  • Develop strong relationships with customers and demonstrate how we can add value;
  • Identify potential customer needs for opportunities to grow the business and improve retention;
  • Respond to customer emails in a professional manner;
  • Set clear and achievable expectations with customers;
  • Take ownership of customer escalations and follow through with resolutions;
  • Comply with all company procedures and policies including OH&S;
  • Proactively contribute to the ongoing development of departmental processes and procedures;
  • Any other tasks or activities as directed by the manager.\xa0

Personal qualities

Commitment to professional excellence, focus on achieving individual, team and organisational objectives:

  • Interpersonal skills: Ability to relate to customers and peers which will help you engage, influence and inspire others;
  • Team player: Ability to put the team before self by empowering others, displaying humility, sharing success with team members and assuming responsibility for undesired and desired outcomes;
  • Commitment to customer experience: Customer focussed, responsive and action orientated to meet customer needs while achieving ongoing engagement and driving proactive discussion to ensure follow through and increased customer satisfaction;
  • Strong communications: Ability to communicate effectively and concisely, both verbally and in written form and to effectively influence and collaborate with team members to achieve objectives;
  • Drive for results: Understands how to get things done and work independently while demonstrating agility to overcome obstacles and achieve objectives.

Commitment to working safely

Ensure a safe workplace is maintained and that Health, Safety and Environment issues are proactively managed according to Sumo’s policy and process.

All OHS incidents are documented and reported according to Sumo’s procedures

Timely identification and removal of workplace hazards.



Experience and education

  • Secondary education;
  • Minimum 2 years’ experience working within a call centre environment;
  • Experience in customer service;
  • Experience in energy retail environment preferred


Skills / competencies / knowledge

  • Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written;
  • Ability to manage customer expectations and relationships;
  • Excellent interpersonal skills;
  • Ability to cross sell as required;
  • Ability to multi task and prioritise if needed;
  • Proficient in Microsoft Office products;
  • Ability to adapt to change.

Do you want to coach people to finally lose weight forever\xa0and transform their whole life?

\xa0

Do you want access to a new ground-breaking evidence-based scientific program that is not about fads, pills, powders, diets or challenges?

\xa0

You\xa0can\xa0become\xa0a\xa0Sum\xa0Sanos\xa0Coach\xa0and\xa0deliver\xa0a\xa0proven\xa0coaching program\xa0that is set to establish a new standard in\xa0weight\xa0management globally.

\xa0

Despite the significant increase in the volume of pills, potions, diets and challenges stealing our attention and consuming our lives, statistics on weight gain and obesity continue to grow – in fact, globally 54% of adults are classified as overweight or obese.

\xa0

What’s\xa0worse\xa0is\xa0that\xa0most\xa0people\xa0who\xa0HAVE\xa0lost\xa0weight\xa0using\xa0these methods, regain\xa0all\xa0or\xa0more\xa0of\xa0the\xa0weight\xa0they\xa0lost\xa0after\xa0twelve\xa0months.

No\xa0Focus\xa0on\xa0Diet\xa0or\xa0Exercise

\xa0

No\xa0Pills, Powders\xa0or\xa0Challenges

\xa0

Sum Sanos means ‘I am Healthy’. It’s an affirmation for good health.

Have a look at one of our Public Relations expsoure here:\xa0 https://vimeo.com/285972124

What\xa0can\xa0I\xa0expect\xa0as\xa0a\xa0Sum\xa0Sanos\xa0Coach?

1. \xa0 \xa0 The first effective evidence based program, tools and support to coach clients to achieve weight loss for life

3. \xa0 \xa0 A unique opportunity to make wellness coaching your full-time career

4. \xa0 \xa0 Access to a powerful marketing system, support and training to ensure you can create a steady stream of clients

Sum\xa0Sanos\xa0Makes\xa0Running\xa0Your\xa0Own\xa0Wellness\xa0Coaching\xa0Business\xa0a Breeze

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 access to program materials and resources

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 regular training, and more.

[

Member Service Advisor

Company Name CPA Australia Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 12 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Our Vision

CPA Australia's Vision is to be known as the world's leading member service organisation, and with 163,000 members across 125 countries we are well positioned to make that vision a reality.

CPA Australia is focused on delivering world class member services and driving the corporate plan to enhance the service offering and grow the membership base. Core services to members include education, training, technical support and advocacy.

The Role

This position reports to the Membership Team Leader. As part of a small team, the Member Service Advisor supports all aspects of membership services and products.

Our Member Service Advisory roles aim to provide the highest standard of service to CPA members by attending to inbound calls, face to face interactions and email enquiries which relate to all aspects of CPA Australia membership, services and products.

Key areas of responsibility include:

  • Take the time to understand members’ needs and goals to develop personalized solutions
  • Engage with key stakeholders to access correct information and the most appropriate member outcomes
  • Provide feedback to leaders to continual improve the products and services available
  • Be an advocate for members by representing the voice of the member in every interaction (meetings, workshops, CRM activities and cases)
  • Constructive contribution to coaching sessions to continually improve your service delivery
  • Deliver service excellence by providing high quality advice, information and solutions
  • Add value to interactions with members by offering additional support, service or suitable products

To succeed you will require:

  • Key to success is a great deal of initiative, resourcefulness and sense of ownership to deliver great outcomes for members
  • A positive, supportive and empathetic mindset
  • Experience in customer/member service roles
  • Ability to communicate effectively and build strong relationships at all levels
  • Adaptable learner with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment
  • Flexibility to work up until 8pm on occasions
  • A tertiary qualification is highly regarded but not essential

Our frontline enquiries provide the team with great opportunities to engage with our members to provide solutions, advice and support for the best member experience.

Please note: this is a 6 months fixed term opportunity.

If you are successful in this role you will have opportunities for growth and career development through regular coaching and training to ensure your skills are second to none. You will have access to CPA Australia's employee benefits, which provide special offers for products and services such as health insurance, home loans, credit cards and publications.

At CPA Australia people are at the heart of what we do. We promote and encourage an inclusive and diverse workplace where everyone can be their best.

Bring your commercial furniture sales expertise and big ideas to our growing B2B Workspace Solutions team! Ongoing expansion of our successful commercial furniture business has created an outstanding consultative sales opportunity for a dynamic and customer focused business development expert.

This position will allow you to perfect your consultative approach to dealing with customers and your focus on solution selling.

  • New customer acquisition and growth of our existing customer base
  • Deliver on our Inspiring Business Solutions by providing a tailored furniture solution based on our clients' needs
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with Officeworks Business Specialists, our CSC and our Retail Store network

  • Superior analytical, problem solving and negotiation skills
  • High attention to detail, accuracy and strong time management skills
  • Experience and competence with measuring, drawing (VISEO) and accurate and timely quote generation
  • Experience with Salesforce


By joining the Officeworks team, you will receive:

  • Fully maintained company car and tools of trade
  • A supportive Manager to continue your career development
  • Opportunities to participate in the Wesfarmers Employee Share Acquisition Plan

Teacher - Game Arts

Company Name Chisholm Institute Company Location Dandenong, AU

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Immediate Start
  • Hourly Rate: $65.01 / $67.57 per hour plus super
  • Location: Dandenong


About Us

Chisholm is Victoria’s premier public vocational education and training provider, with campuses located across Melbourne and the south east.

Each year, we welcome some 30,000 students from over 43 culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds. More than 1,200 passionate and dedicated Chisholm employees work together to deliver quality training and education in Melbourne’s south east manufacturing heartland and key residential growth corridor.

A Victorian Government-owned TAFE, we aim to lead the way in education and training to inspire success and transform lives.

Our purpose is to excel in education and training and be respected and valued for enhancing the social and economic futures of individuals, industry and communities.

Our drive for commercial success is underpinned by our core values of Opportunity, Integrity, Collaboration, and Achievement.

In the past 20 years, we have grown significantly to become a multi-sector institute, delivering a broad range of education and training programs and services in higher education, vocational education and training (VET) and school sectors across ten campuses in Victoria, online, in the workplace and overseas with partner educational and government organisations.

We offer nearly 500 courses, from VCE/VCAL/VETiS, through to nationally accredited qualifications such as certificates, diplomas, advanced diplomas, degrees, graduate certificates, graduate diplomas and short courses.

About The Role

As a Casual Teacher, you will be accountable for providing teaching and vocational expertise across all aspects of delivery, planning and performance.

This role will focus on providing support in scripting/programming in context of Game Art, teaching the following units:
  • ICTGAM401 Produce an interactive game and;
  • ICTICT418 Contribute to copyright, ethics and privacy in an ICT environment media


About You

You will have relevant tertiary qualification in
  • Certificate IV in Training and Assessment (TAE40110)
  • Relevant Vocational qualifications at AQF level 4
  • Vocational currency as demonstrated through a range of work and related experience

Crucial to your success will be your up to-date and engaging programs, learning materials and teaching delivery plans in a learning environment, that motivates and guides students to optimise their learning outcomes.

You are highly motivated, with exceptional communication skills, your personal style is flexible and collaborative and are a highly motivated individual with the ability to contribute to team capability and operate as part of a high performing team.

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are encouraged to apply.

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

At Chisholm, we embrace differences in gender, age, ethnicity, race, cultural background, disability, religion and sexual orientation. We know that diversity and inclusion helps us to attract, recruit, engage and retain a team of talented people. If you require specific support to apply for this position, please advise the recruiting manager whose contact details are listed in the advertisement. We will work with you to identify the best way to assist you.

How To Apply

Applications

Applications for this position closes on 9am Monday 15 October 2018.

Applications Should Include
  • a covering letter
  • curriculum vitae
  • contact details of three (3) referees

Appointment to this position is subject to satisfactory completion of Safety Screening requirements including but not limited to:
  • valid Employee Working With Children Check
  • verification of unrestricted work rights in Australia, eg citizenship, passport or birth certificate
  • certified copies of qualifications

If you have any questions regarding the position or require further information please contact David Trout, Operations Manager, Art and Design on 03 9212 5302.

Chisholm Institute reserves the right to withdraw an advertised position at any stage.

Located on Tope Street, the centre is conveniently located within 300m walking distance of both Park Street and Sturt Street light rail stations.


The centre is due to open in January 2019, this is your opportunity to be integral in the creation of inspirational learning spaces and building your new team.


Spread across three levels this 120-place centre will sit above Melbourne’s skyline giving up unparallel views of the city. This custom-built and architecturally designed space will offer expansive indoor/outdoor play areas. We will have a commercial grade kitchen that will be used as a learning environment, featuring an open servery. Parents will be invited for breakfast and meals will be shared together in the piazza.


Architecturally designed to offer a nurturing and stimulating early learning environment for children aged 6 weeks to 6 years. \xa0It will be equipped with Reggio-inspired materials, high quality, natural resources with huge windows which will connect the children with the community and their surroundings. On the 3rd level the centre will also feature a well-resourced atelier on the roof top yard, where children can express their creative skills.


\xa0Your role as Centre Manager\xa0

  • The development of a quality service and pedagogical leadership
  • Team leadership, development and educator engagement

  • Establishing meaningful connections within the community and your families

Our Centre Managers are encouraged to run their centres with a high degree of autonomy. Centre Managers who thrive at Guardian are those with a strong vision for their centre, who are good with people, who aren't afraid to make decisions and to speak their mind and who strive to running their Centres at full occupancy.

912633022:
[

Associate or Senior Associate, Corporate - Energy and Resources (Melbourne)

Company Name Allens Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 14 hours ago Number of views 19 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Allens


Allens is an international law firm with offices throughout Australia and Asia. Through an integrated alliance with Linklaters, we offer clients access to an extensive network comprising 40 offices in 28 countries. Allens offers one of the most comprehensive legal networks in Australia and Asia.


We have been named Australian Law Firm of the Year in the Chambers Asia-Pacific Awards 2017 thanks to positive feedback from our clients. The award caps off a year of working with clients on some of Australia's largest and most complex deals.


The opportunity


The energy and resources industry is changing rapidly. At Allens, we are regularly sought out by major resources clients to assist them with large-scale projects and complex commercial transactions across the oil and gas and mining sectors. Our expertise is based on a long history of working on a wide range of projects and transactions in Australia and internationally.


Our experience in the energy and resources sector includes sales, acquisitions and restructures; the generation, transmission, distribution and supply of electricity and gas; minerals and petroleum exploration and production; and on issues relating to climate change, native title and water resources.


As a result of growth and change within the industry, we are now seeking to recruit an experienced Associate or Senior Associate to join our Melbourne Corporate practice group with specific experience and interest on the energy and resources industry and related law and legal agreements common to the energy and resources industry. Working with leading energy and resources specialists, you will use your extensive experience and expertise in this sector to represent successfully the interests of mining companies and oil and gas companies (from global majors to mid caps), in their various capacities including as joint venture participants and joint venture operators, buyers or sellers of gas, electricity, or other commodities such as iron ore and coal, or as buyers and sellers of various mining and oil and gas assets and projects.


You'll play a key role within the practice group, drawing on the expertise of lawyers in other groups within the firm for areas such as financing or taxation. You'll also have access to worldwide expertise through the Linklaters alliance. As a specialist energy and resources lawyer at Allens, you'll be relied on for your strategic knowledge, technical and negotiating skills, and your commercial approach.


What you'll bring


To succeed in this role you will need



  • An interest and extensive experience in the energy and resources sector ideally at a leading Australian practice or international firm.

  • Experience in joint ventures and joint venture agreements, resources project acquisitions and disposals, State Agreements, project development and restructuring, commodity marketing, and gas and electricity supply and transportation agreements.

  • An ability to effectively manage small matters and elements of larger matters. In the case of a Senior Associate, an ability to effectively manage large matters and lead teams.

  • A desire and ability to grow, both as a lawyer and leader.

  • A willingness to build an understanding of clients and develop effective working relationships.

  • An ability to establish a professional profile and internal networks including across all our offices as we work as an integrated mining and oil and gas team.

  • A willingness to develop others through mentoring and sharing experiences and networks.

  • A willingness to travel around Australia and overseas as required for work e.g. negotiations, workshops and client business development and marketing.


What we'll offer


At Allens, we’re focused on advancing our industry through equipping our people with the skills and experience they need to be the lawyers of the future. We’re ready to define tomorrow. Are you?


With us, you’ll be more than a lawyer. Our people are technical experts, but they’re also trusted business advisers who think bigger, more broadly and more strategically. Together, we solve complex legal challenges, and collaborate across practice areas and disciplines to guide our clients.


We work across borders too, thanks to our alliance with Linklaters. This strategic partnership opens up worlds of opportunity for our business and our people, including rotations in Linklaters London, Hong Kong and Singapore for our graduate lawyers.


In a rapidly changing world, we seek opportunities to innovate, embracing creative thinking, new approaches and emerging technology. And we don’t just use them to benefit ourselves and our clients. We believe strongly in driving positive change to do right by our community too.


Our teams are open, inclusive and encouraging, giving you the chance to learn and grow, but your development will be down to you. You’ll have the flexibility to drive your career, and we’ll recognise your achievements and hard work as you progress through the firm. Are you ready to begin?


How to apply

We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Executive Assistant to join our Retail Insurance team based at our head office in St Kilda Road. This role is diverse and fast paced and will provide a high level of administrative and organisational support to the Chief Retail Insurance Officer and teams.

Specific responsibilities include complex diary management, booking of meetings, arranging travel and accommodation. You will also manage the purchase order invoicing system and general office duties including but not limited to, maintaining office supplies for stationery, photocopier and printers, catering and any other duties as requested by staff members.

The successful applicant must have previous experience in supporting an Executive(s) or Senior Management, ideally within the Insurance, Health or professional services industry. Strong communication, planning and organisation skills are essential, along with the ability to multi-task effectively. You will have administration management experience and demonstrate qualities of customer service, accuracy, flexibility and self-motivation. Strong knowledge of MS packages such as Word, Power Point and Excel will all be essential for the role.

WE’RE FOR your wellbeing…

We understand healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing, inclusion and flexibility. With fruit box deliveries, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership (including a FitBit!), we endorse work-life balance.

WE’RE FOR your recognition…

We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.

WE’RE FOR your success…

Your success is ours. Not only do we provide you with all the resources for you to thrive, we enable you to be the best that you can be. We encourage creative thinking and you will even be rewarded for it!

WE’RE FOR you…

[

Group Manager, Member and Stakeholder Relations

Company Name Australian Energy Market Operator (AEMO) Company Location Level 22 530 Collins St, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 42 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Role:

We are looking for a Stakeholder Relations professional to provide executive direction to lead the strategic development, implementation and management of engagement activities that better understand AEMO members and broader AEMO stakeholder base that drives value and benefits for consumers.

\xa0

Reporting to the Executive General Manager Public Affairs, the role will lead the Member and Stakeholder Relations division to engage and partner with key stakeholder groups and senior executives, as well as driving results through leadership. You will be highly driven, and results-focused, and always act with AEMO’s strategic direction and goals at the forefront of everything you do.

\xa0

In this arena, no two days are the same, however some of your day to day key accountabilities will include:

\xa0

  • Engaging with stakeholder and/or member management and customer advocacy to explain, negotiate, educate, and influence proposed market design and operational changes
  • Develop and lead member and stakeholder interactions that are balanced, consistent and credible with a customer front-of-mind.
  • Maintaining excellent relationships with existing members and senior representatives, key market participants, potential new entrants and regulatory bodies
  • Monitor and advise on policy changes which may impact on AEMO’s operations and support the engagement activities to positively influence AEMO members.
  • Working with the wider Public Affairs Leadership team to deliver shared objectives
  • Maintain customer satisfaction through increased customer focus and strengthened relations and communications.

\xa0

Required skills and experience:

\xa0

  • Appropriate tertiary and / or postgraduate qualifications in a relevant discipline in stakeholder engagement, strategic communications and/or proven experience in external member-based organisations.
  • Demonstrated stakeholder engagement experience in complex environments with 10 plus years’ relevant experience in a similar senior role
  • Demonstrated experience in complex stakeholder relations environments and the ability to navigate and lead stakeholder consultative processes and/or commercial drivers in a complex, technical, commercial or regulatory environment
  • Commercially savvy and customer-focussed
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate and challenge issues to influence desired outcomes
  • Resilience and strong work ethic and experience in working collaboratively within matrix management environments
  • Knowledge and understanding of the operation of an energy market, regulatory framework and industry structure (advantageous)
  • Previous experience in member-based organisations (advantageous)


Your career with AEMO

AEMO has some of Australia’s finest energy sector talent in its midst. Our work is intellectually challenging, and our people gain enormous satisfaction from solving the complex problems constantly facing them.

The continuing interplay of shifts in energy generation, reliability, affordability, and a low emissions future will ensure we at AEMO continue to be challenged and driven for many years to come.

So, make your next career move one that really matters!


Some of our employment benefits:

Here are some of the attractive employment benefits we offer:

  • Professional development via projects, assignments, industry networks and job rotation
  • Flexible working: work from home, part time and job share
  • Discount health insurance, gym membership and other concessions
  • Free salary continuance insurance and annual performance bonuses *

* Subject to eligibility


Apply now to join us and take your place alongside like-minded passionate, driven individuals in the Energy sector: one of the world’s most exciting and dynamic industries.


Click ‘apply’ to submit your CV and cover letter by C.O.B Monday 15th October 2018.

\xa0

No agency applications will be accepted at this time.

Be Part Of Something New

These New Opportunities Include
